elements.promptDetail: During the past month, which statement best describes the kinds of physical activity you usually did as part of your job or work? Do not include activities during breaks or outside of work. Please read all four statements before selecting one.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day sitting or standing
enumeration.promptDetail: When I was at work, I did such things as writing, typing, talking on the telephone, assembling small parts, or operating a machine that takes very little exertion or strength. If I drove a car or truck while at work, I did not lift or carry anything for more that a few minutes each day.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day walking or using my hands and arms in work that required moderate exertion.
enumeration.promptDetail: When I was at work, I did such things as delivering mail, patrolling on guard duty, doing mechanical work on automobiles or other large machines, house painting, or operating a machine that requires some moderate-activity work of me. If I drove a truck or lift, my job required me to lift and carry things frequently.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day lifting or carrying heavy objects or moving most of my body in some other way.
enumeration.promptDetail: When I was at work, I did such things as stacking cargo or inventory, handling parts or materials, or doing work like that of a carpenter who builds structures or a gardener who does most of the work without machines.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day doing hard physical labor.
enumeration.promptDetail: When I was at work, I did such things as digging or chopping with heavy tools or carrying heavy loads (bricks, for example) to the place where they were to be used. If I drove a truck or operated equipment, my job also required me to do hard physical work most of the day with only short breaks.

elements.promptDetail: During the past month, which statement best describes the kinds of physical activity you usually did? Do not include the time you spent as part of your work or job. Please read all six statements before selecting one.

enumeration.label: I did not do much physical activity.
enumeration.promptDetail: I mostly did things like watching television, reading, playing cards, or playing computer games. Only occasionally, no more than once or twice a month, did I do anything more active such as going for a walk or playing tennis.

enumeration.label: Once or twice a week, I did light activities
enumeration.promptDetail: Such as getting outdoors on the weekends for an easy walk or stroll. Or once or twice a week, I did chores around the house such as sweeping floors or vacuuming.

enumeration.label: About three times a week, I did moderate activities
enumeration.promptDetail: Such as brisk walking, swimming, or riding a bike for about 15–20 minutes each time. Or about once a week, I did moderately difficult chores such as raking or mowing the lawn for about 45–60 minutes. Or about once a week, I played sports such as softball, basketball, or soccer for about 45–60 minutes.

enumeration.label: Almost daily, that is five or more times a week, I did moderate activities
enumeration.promptDetail: Such as brisk walking, swimming, or riding a bike for 30 minutes or more each time. Or about once a week, I did moderately difficult chores or played sports for 2 hours or more.

enumeration.label: About three times a week, I did vigorous activities
enumeration.promptDetail: Such as running or riding hard on a bike for 30 minutes or more each time.

enumeration.label: Almost daily, that is, five or more times a week, I did vigorous activities
enumeration.promptDetail: Such as running or riding hard on a bike for 30 minutes or more each time.

elements.prompt: Overall, how many minutes of moderate activity do you get in a week?
elements.promptDetail: A person doing moderate-intensity activity, such as a brisk walk, can usually talk but not sing during the activity.

elements.prompt: Overall, how many minutes of vigorous activity do you get in a week?
elements.promptDetail: A person doing vigorous-intensity activity, such as running, usually cannot say more than a few words without pausing for a breath.

elements.prompt: How much sleep do you usually get at night on weekdays or workdays?

How much sleep do think you need every night to be rested? 
(in hours)
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you have a sleep disorder?
Which of the following sleep disorders apply to you? (select all that apply).

enumeration.label: Circadian Rhythm Disturbance (Advanced/Delayed Sleep Phase, Shift work)
Restless Legs Syndrome and/or Periodic Limb Movements
REM Behavior Disorder (act out dreams in your sleep)
